newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish shares end up in live trade.
newsitem.headline: Polish shares end up in live trade.

text.p: Four stocks rose, one fell and seven were flat in Warsaw bourse continuous trade on Tuesday.
Turnover was at 6.9 million zlotys, up from Monday's 1.7 million zlotys.
NFI units were flat at 139.5 zlotys in a turnover of eight million zlotys.
The continuous trading system, which currently lists 15 companies, is separate from the bourse's main single-price auction system in which the same firms and 65 others are traded.
At the single-price auction session most stocks fell and the main market's index eased 0.5 percent.
